0.title: Your safety is never a joke: Mumbai Police on comedian's joke about city's seat belt rule
0.article_body: Comedian Atul Khatri took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a photo of a model wearing a t-shirt with a seat belt printed on it and said, "Mumbaikars! Please wear seat belts from today or buy this t-shirt." Meanwhile, Mumbai Police responded, "We shall keep them in stock for you, along with our challans. Your safety is never a joke!"

1.title: Kerala judge's transfer over 'sexually provocative' dress remark quashed
1.article_body: Kerala High Court has quashed the transfer of the Kozhikode district sessions judge who had recently made the "sexually provocative" dress remark. While granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case, the judge had said that the offence under IPC Section 354A is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses".

2.title: Don't lose yourself in relationship: Ishaan on Shahid's advice for him
2.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter was recently asked to share the best relationship advice he received from his brother Shahid Kapoor. "My brother has told me not to lose myself in a relationship; to always know who I am...That's very good advice," Khatter said in response. Ishaan, who had previously mentioned that he's currently single, was rumoured to be dating Ananya Panday.

3.title: Would google or call Salman bhai, Tiger for tips: SRK on his fitness during COVID-19
3.article_body: During an event on his 57th birthday, Shah Rukh Khan spoke about his fitness routine during the COVID-19 pandemic. He said, "Once I woke up, I'd go to the gym for 30-45 mins, where no trainer was allowed due to quarantine. So I'd google the exercises that I could do or would call Salman bhai, Tiger and Hrithik for suggestions."

4.title: AC Milan enter CL round of 16 for the first time in 9 years
4.article_body: AC Milan entered the round of 16 stage in the ongoing season of the Champions League, following a 4-0 win against RB Salzburg. Olivier Giroud scored a brace as Milan entered the knockout phase in an edition of the tournament for the first time in nine years. Chelsea and Manchester City also recorded wins against Dinamo Zagreb and Sevilla respectively.

5.title: Declare Hesaraghatta grasslands as conservation reserve: B'luru residents
5.article_body: A proposal demanding recognition of Hesaraghatta grasslands as a conservation reserve has been signed by 75,000 Bengaluru residents and was handed over to the Principal Chief Conservator of Forests Vijayakumar Gogi. Meanwhile, the State Board for Wildlife will hold a meeting regarding the 5,000 acres grasslands today. The grasslands is located over 40 km away from Bengaluru.

6.title: Pune City Police raids 2 illegal rooftop hookah parlours in Kondhwa
6.article_body: The Crime Branch of the Pune City Police on Tuesday raided two rooftop restaurants in Kondhwa for running illegal hookah parlours. Police raided the restaurants, where customers were allegedly being served hookah, following a tip-off and booked two persons. Hookah pots and flavoured tobacco material estimated to be worth ₹65,210 were seized from the restaurants.

7.title: Bangladesh's Nurul Hasan accuses Virat Kohli of 'fake fielding'
7.article_body: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batter Nurul Hasan has accused Virat Kohli of 'fake fielding' during India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match. "There was...a fake throw. It could've been a five-run penalty," Nurul stated. He was referring to Kohli miming a relay throw at non-striker's end despite not having the ball in Bangladesh's seventh over. India won the match by five runs (DLS method).

8.title: Kanye paid settlement to ex-worker who claimed he praised Hitler in meetings: Report
8.article_body: Kanye West reportedly paid a settlement to a former employee over allegations that he praised Hitler and Nazis during business meetings. As per a report, while West denied the claims, other former employees said there were numerous instances where the rapper used anti-semitic language. Notably, several companies like Gap and Adidas have cut ties with West over his anti-semitic remarks.

9.title: Elon Musk responds to US politician Alexandria's tweet on his $8 charge for blue tick
9.article_body: Elon Musk has responded after US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, "Lmao at a billionaire earnestly trying to sell people on the idea that 'free speech' is actually a $8/month subscription plan." "Your feedback is appreciated, now pay $8," Musk responded. Earlier, Musk tweeted, "To all complainers, please continue complaining, but it will cost $8."

10.title: 5 Uzbek women go missing from shelter home in Delhi's Dwarka
10.article_body: At least five of seven Uzbek women, rescued from a sex trafficking racket by Delhi Police in August, went missing from a shelter home in Dwarka. "We knew they were in danger...had informed local police several times over the phone," a private NGO official claimed. The women were brought to India via Nepal and forced into sex work, police said.

11.title: Elon Musk planning to cut half of Twitter's workforce: Report
11.article_body: Elon Musk plans to cut about 3,700 jobs or half of Twitter's workforce in a bid to cut costs, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the matter. Musk will inform the staff affected on Friday, the report added. Musk also intends to reverse the social media company's existing work from anywhere policy, the report further said.

12.title: Election Commission to announce Gujarat Assembly election dates today
12.article_body: The Election Commission will announce the dates for the Gujarat Assembly election today. Last month, the schedule for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly election was announced, with voting set to begin on November 12 and counting to take place on December 8. According to ECI sources, voting in Gujarat may be held in two phases in the first week of December.

13.title: Voting begins for Assembly by-polls in Bihar, Maharashtra, H'yana, T'gana, UP and Odisha
13.article_body: Voting has begun for Assembly by-polls in seven vacant seats across six states. Voting is being held for Mokama and Gopalganj seats in Bihar, Andheri (East) in Maharashtra, Adampur in Haryana, Munugode in Telangana, Gola Gokarannath in Uttar Pradesh and Dhamnagar in Odisha. The counting of votes for all these seats will be held on Sunday.

14.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 4th time in a row
14.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the fourth straight time. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 3.75% to 4%, the highest since January 2008. Further, this is the sixth time this year that the Fed has raised its key rate.

15.title: Kohli breaks Sachin's record for scoring most runs by an Indian in a country outside India
15.article_body: Virat Kohli has broken Sachin Tendulkar's record for scoring most international runs by an India batter in a country outside India. With his 64*(44) against Bangladesh in Adelaide today, Kohli took his tally of international runs in Australia to 3,350. He overtook Sachin, who scored 3,300 runs in Australia. Sachin's 2,686-run tally in Sri Lanka comes third on the list.

16.title: Cong election body to meet on Nov 4, finalise candidates for Guj polls
16.article_body: Congress Central Election Committee is set to meet on November 4 to finalise candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The meeting will be held at the party headquarters in Delhi. Congress had put up a strong fight in the last Assembly polls. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced the names of more than 100 candidates for the upcoming elections.

17.title: US FDA points out manufacturing lapses at Lupin's Tarapur API plant
17.article_body: US Food and Drug Administration (US FDA) has pointed out various manufacturing lapses at drug maker Lupin's Tarapur plant in Thane, which produces active pharmaceutical ingredients (API). In a warning letter, FDA said the plant failed to establish adequate written procedures for cleaning equipment. The health regulator inspected the plant from March 22 to April 4, 2022.

18.title: Pigs lick utensils at govt-run canteen in Rajasthan; video surfaces
18.article_body: A video showing pigs licking utensils meant to serve the poor at a government-run canteen in Rajasthan's Bharatpur has surfaced online. The plates that pigs were licking were designated for the poor under the Congress-led government's Indira Rasoi Yojana. Bharatpur Municipal Corporation (BMC) has terminated the contract with the organisation that was operating the canteen and has issued a notice.

19.title: Akali Dal suspends Jagir Kaur over "anti-party" activities
19.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) suspended Jagir Kaur, the first woman chief of the gurdwara committee, from the party on Wednesday over "anti-party activities". SAD disciplinary committee chairman Sikander Singh Maluka said the party had received complaints that Jagir was pressuring party members to support her for the post of Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee president against the party's wish.

20.title: UP CM Yogi demotes DSP for taking bribe to suppress gang-rape case
20.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has reportedly demoted Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Vidya Kishore Sharma. He was suspended in December 2021 after a video of him accepting ₹5 lakh bribe to suppress a gang-rape case in Rampur, where he was posted as DSP, went viral. An investigation into the matter has found Sharma guilty.

21.title: Woman of Pak origin arrested in Bihar while trying to sneak into Nepal
21.article_body: An American national of Pakistani origin was arrested in Bihar's Kishanganj district while trying to sneak into Nepal without valid documents, police said. Investigations revealed that Farida Mallik, who carried an American passport, is a resident of California. Mallik confessed to have travelled to Nepal via India a number of times and was once put in jail for the same.

22.title: Germany considering plan to levy charge on single-use plastic
22.article_body: The German government on Wednesday said it is planning to levy a charge on the manufacturers of single-use plastic products. According to a draft law, the funds acquired would be used to cover the costs of municipalities in clearing up litter. "With the new law, we are counteracting the waste of resources and environmental pollution," said Environment Minister Steffi Lemke.

23.title: Concerned about the safety of Chinese workers in Pakistan: China
23.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday expressed "deep concern" to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif over the safety of Chinese nationals working in Pakistan on the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor projects. Sharif is on a two-day official visit to China. Sharif has become the first head of government to felicitate Xi, after he secured an unprecedented third term in office.

24.title: Fans erect 30-foot-tall cutout of Lionel Messi in middle of river in Kerala, pic viral
24.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing a 30-foot-tall cutout of Argentina forward Lionel Messi being erected in the middle of a river in Kerala. The cutout was put up by an Argentina fan club of Pullavoor. A video had also surfaced online showing several fans carrying the cutout on a road.

25.title: Election battle 'is over': Brazil’s Bolsonaro to SC members
25.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has told some members of the Supreme Court (SC) that his election battle against President-elect Lula da Silva 'is over'. Earlier, Bolsonaro did not concede defeat, as his supporters blocked highways and some called for a military coup. According to Supreme Court Justice Luiz Edson Fachin, Bolsonaro said, "It is over. So, let's look ahead."

26.title: Russia has agreed to the resumption of grain export: Turkish Prez
26.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Wednesday said Russia has agreed to allow the export of Ukrainian grain via a route in the Black Sea. Russia last week suspended the shipments, as it alleged a drone attack was thwarted on Crimea. Erdogan said Russia's Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu had informed his Turkish counterpart regarding the go-ahead for grain export.

27.title: Chennai woman falls into open manhole, video shows people pulling her out
27.article_body: A 24-year-old woman fell into an open manhole constructed for laying a stormwater drain in Chennai's Perambur area on Wednesday. A video of the incident that surfaced online showed people rushing to the manhole and pulling the woman out. The manhole was not visible as the road was waterlogged following heavy rains.

28.title: Elon Musk says Twitter won't restore banned accounts without 'clear process'
28.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Wednesday said the platform will not allow anyone who was de-platformed for violating its rules "back on platform until we have a clear process for doing so". Musk added the process would take at least a few more weeks. "Twitter's content moderation council will include representatives with widely divergent views," he further added.

29.title: 3.5 lakh lost jobs in Ballari jeans industry due to note ban, GST: Cong
29.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday claimed that 3.5 lakh people working in the jeans industry in Karnataka's Ballari lost their jobs due to note ban (demonetisation) and "faulty" implementation of GST. The MP further noted that government-owned companies are in constant fear of privatisation. He added, "[Modi government aims] to create panic so that farmers and labourers are scared."

30.title: We made a mistake: Ex-reporter of The Wire on BJP-Meta reports
30.article_body: The Wire's ex-reporter Devesh Kumar admitted on Wednesday that the news portal was at fault regarding its reports that accused Facebook's parent company Meta of according special privileges to BJP IT Cell. "We made a mistake in reporting...A lot of documents we received...were false," Kumar said. This comes after The Wire accused Kumar of providing forged documents for the reports.

31.title: Need time to provide minority tag to Hindus in some states: Centre to SC
31.article_body: The Centre has asked the Supreme Court to grant it more time to complete consultations with states and union territories on the issue of granting minority status to Hindus in some states. Centre has termed the matter "sensitive", adding that it "will have far-reaching ramifications". The Hindu community comprises approximately 80% of the country's population, according to 2011 census data.

32.title: North Korea is covertly supplying artillery shells to Russia: US
32.article_body: US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby has said they've information that indicates North Korea is covertly supplying "significant" number of artillery shells to Russia for its Ukraine war. It was attempting to obscure the shipments by funneling them through Middle East and North Africa countries, he said. We'll consult with UN on accountability issues over the shipments, he added.

33.title: UK PM Sunak reverses decision to skip UN climate summit
33.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Wednesday said he will attend the upcoming United Nations (UN) climate summit in Egypt. Earlier, Sunak's office said the prime minister would skip COP27 as there were "pressing domestic commitments", which include preparations for the government's budget statement due on November 17. Sunak's decision to skip the meet was criticised.

34.title: Germany keeper Neuer reveals he was diagnosed with skin cancer, underwent 3 surgeries
34.article_body: Germany goalkeeper Manuel Neuer on Wednesday revealed that he was diagnosed with skin cancer. Neuer said that he has a scar near his nose, adding, "I had to be operated on three times and I had skin cancer there." Neuer, who won FIFA World Cup with Germany in 2014, didn't say when the operations took place.

35.title: Pic shows Twitter employee sleeping on the office floor after Musk's takeover
35.article_body: A Twitter employee shared a picture of Esther Crawford, Twitter's Director of Product Management, sleeping on the floor at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters. "When you need something from your boss at Elon Twitter," the employee captioned the picture, indicating it was taken after Elon Musk purchased Twitter. "Doing hard things requires sacrifice," Crawford tweeted in response to her picture.

36.title: India has role to play in political stability of B'desh: B'deshi minister
36.article_body: India's role in ensuring regional stability has helped Bangladesh maintain its political stability, Bangladesh Information Minister Hasan Mahmud said on Tuesday. Mahmud added that India has contributed to the progress of the country. "The relationship between India and Bangladesh is very diverse, it doesn't depend only on the Teesta water sharing. We are sharing many things," he further stated.

37.title: Sangrur sees 30% rise in patients with respiratory issues post Diwali
37.article_body: Punjab's Sangrur has witnessed around 30% rise in patients with respiratory issues, including cough, breathlessness, runny nose and itchiness in the eyes since Diwali. "Around 30 to 35 patients complaining about breathlessness, cough and other problems are visiting everyday," Dr Himanshu Garg, deployed at civil hospital, said. This year, Sangrur district is also worst hit due to stubble burning.

38.title: Akshay Kumar to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in Manjrekar's next
38.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar is set to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in filmmaker-actor Mahesh Manjrekar's directorial 'Veer Daudale Saat'. The film, which will be a pan-India Marathi film, is scheduled to release on Diwali 2023. Earlier this year, Akshay played the role of another historical figure Prithviraj Chauhan in the film 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

39.title: Haryana farmers facing shortage of DAP fertiliser: Bhupinder Hooda
39.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday claimed that farmers in the state were facing shortage of diammonium phosphate fertiliser. "The situation is such that even after standing in queues for several days, farmers are not getting fertilisers for their crops," Hooda said. Criticising the government, he said Haryana has the highest unemployment rate of 31.8%.

40.title: Our aim is to keep 'Arjuna's eye' on inflation: RBI Governor Das
40.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the central bank wishes to concentrate on inflation in the same way as Arjuna focussed on hitting the eye of a revolving fish in the epic Mahabharata. "No one can match the prowess of Arjuna, but our constant endeavour is to keep an Arjuna's eye on inflation," Das said.

41.title: Model Heidi Klum dresses up as a worm for Halloween; pics go viral
41.article_body: Model Heidi Klum dressed up as a worm for her annual Halloween party and pictures of her look have gone viral. When asked about the outfit, Heidi said while laying down on the red carpet, "I don't know. I wanted to be something random. I wanted to think outside the box." "That's some commitment," a social media user commented.

42.title: Sikh soldier's statue unveiled in UK to honour those who fought in World Wars
42.article_body: A Sikh soldier's statue was unveiled in the UK on Sunday to honour contributions of the community, members of which fought in both World Wars for UK. The statue was reportedly made by artist Taranjit Singh. "We...honour the sacrifice of all those...who travelled [here] to fight for a country that wasn't their own," a Sikh group official said.

43.title: 2 women officers promoted as Inspector General for 1st time in CRPF
43.article_body: Two CRPF women officers have been promoted to the rank of Inspector General for the first time in the paramilitary force. IG Seema Dhundia will head the Bihar Sector of CRPF, while IG Annie Abraham will head Rapid Action Force (RAF), the CRPF said in a statement. This is the first time that RAF will be headed by a woman.

44.title: I wish the dating rumours about me were true: Siddhant Chaturvedi
44.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, during an interview, was asked to share a rumour that he wishes were true. To this, he replied, "That I am dating, seeing someone. I wish that was true." This comes after there were rumours of Siddhant dating Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda. Siddhant will next feature in 'Phone Bhoot'.

45.title: 50-yr-old man killed as fire breaks out at paper godown in UP
45.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Lal Bahadur, was charred to death in a fire that broke out at a paper mill godown in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur in the early hours of Wednesday, police said. Bahadur, an employee, who was sleeping in the middle of paper bundles, got trapped inside and died. Property worth ₹2 crore was also destroyed, police added.

46.title: India test-fires Phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence interceptor
46.article_body: India on Wednesday conducted the successful maiden flight test of phase-II Ballistic Missile Defence (BMD) interceptor, AD-1 missile, from APJ Abdul Kalam Island in Odisha. The missile has a large kill altitude bracket. All BMD elements participated in the test. "AD-1 is a long-range interceptor missile designed for both low exo-atmospheric and endo-atmospheric interception," an official said.

47.title: SEBI's refunds to Sahara investors reach ₹138 crore since 2012
47.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has processed ₹138 crore refunds to investors of two Sahara companies since 2012. The regulator added that the amount deposited in specially-opened bank accounts for the repayment has risen to over ₹24,000 crore. SEBI segregated ₹63,206 crore in dues pertaining to PACL Ltd and a Sahara Group company as "difficult to recover".

48.title: Never saw such huge influx of bodies: Crematoriums on Morbi tragedy
48.article_body: Crematoriums and graveyards in Gujarat's Morbi said they never saw a huge influx of bodies in such a short span of time in decades as they saw after the bridge collapse. At least 135 people were killed and several others were injured after the suspension bridge on Machchhu river collapsed on Sunday. Meanwhile, search for bodies continues at the site.

49.title: Congress synonymous with corruption, mafia: UP CM Yogi in Himachal
49.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath criticised the Congress and said the party was synonymous with mafia and corruption. Addressing election rallies in Himachal Pradesh, he said it is the responsibility of people of Himachal Pradesh to keep these evils away. "The double engine government has given Himachal AIIMS, IIT, IIM, medical college...and free ration during...pandemic," he said.

50.title: Oil firms lose ₹4 per litre on diesel: Hardeep Puri on talks of price cut
50.article_body: Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said PSU oil companies are losing a net ₹4 per litre on diesel, while speaking about talks of a price reduction. Puri said his ministry will seek assistance for three fuel retailers, IOC, BPCL and HPCL, for the losses they incurred on holding petrol and diesel prices since the Ukraine war to tackle inflation.

51.title: Kohli's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheers for him in Adelaide, says 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai'
51.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli and Team India's Hindi-speaking Chinese fan cheering for him in Adelaide. In the video, the fan can be heard saying, "Bharat Mata Ki Jai." The fan, who did not reveal his name, added that he learned Hindi because he loves Indian culture and is a language student at the Adelaide University.

52.title: BJP's Gautam Gambhir summoned over unauthorised construction on MCD dumping yard
52.article_body: A Delhi court has issued summon to BJP MP Gautam Gambhir over alleged unauthorised construction of a library on MCD land meant to be a dumping yard. The library has been constructed near Karkardooma court. As per summon, Gambhir must appear before the court on December 13. The petitioners are seeking an order to restrain Gambhir from using the library.

53.title: Never been abusive with Kejriwal: Delhi L-G office
53.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has never been abusive in his communication with Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, a statement from Raj Niwas stated on Wednesday. "On the contrary, even in matters of extreme breach of propriety or blatant verbal misconduct on part of the CM, his ministers and members of AAP, the L-G has...refrained from any comment," it added.

54.title: Rahul plays cricket with boy during Bharat Jodo Yatra, shares video
54.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted a video of him playing cricket with a boy on a road in Hyderabad during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. The boy was seen wearing a jersey of Team India. Rahul tweeted, "Donning the India jersey...makes you unbeatable. Well played #TeamIndia!" This comes after Team India defeated Bangladesh in the T20 World Cup 2022.

55.title: Teaser of 'Pathaan' copied from other films, claim Twitter users; share pics
55.article_body: After the teaser of 'Pathaan' was released, several Twitter users called out the makers for copying scenes from movies like 'WAR' and 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. They shared comparison pictures and pointed out resemblances. "Why [do]...action sequences in 'Pathaan' teaser keep reminding me of 'Winter Soldier'," a tweet read. Others also pointed out similarities with 'Dus' and 'Saaho'.

56.title: Encouraged to be recognized worldwide: Prateik on 'Four...' Emmy nomination
56.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his show 'Four More Shots Please!' getting nominated at the International Emmy Award for Comedy in 2020, has said that it was extremely encouraging to be recognised worldwide. "There's a benchmark that has been set...we need to take it up a notch," the actor added. The show also featured Bani J and Kirti Kulhari.

57.title: Very little to do: Goa CBI on not having enough cases
57.article_body: The anti-corruption branch of Goa's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) said that it has "very little to do" as there aren't enough cases. The superintendent of police heading the team of five officers said that the last bribery case they received was in 2018. SP (CBI) Ashesh Kumar said that over the last year, only three cases were registered.

58.title: Taking DNA of rape accused for probe not violation of his right: Kerala HC
58.article_body: The Kerala HC has said that a rape accused being asked to provide his DNA for criminal probe doesn't violate his constitutional right against self-incrimination. Justice Kauser Edappagath said the privilege of Article 20(3) is applicable only to testimonial evidence. The HC upheld a trial court's order urging a rape accused to provide his blood sample for a paternity test.

59.title: BYJU'S plans $1 billion IPO of subsidiary Aakash next fiscal: Report
59.article_body: BYJU'S is planning to list its subsidiary Aakash, an offline coaching chain, in the first half of next year, Moneycontrol reported. The size of the IPO could be in the range of $1 billion, valuing Aakash at $3.5-$4 billion. According to the report, BYJU'S plans to list by June 2024, or the first half of FY24.

60.title: SEBI categorises dues worth ₹67,228 crore as 'difficult to recover'
60.article_body: SEBI has segregated dues of ₹67,228 crore under "difficult to recover" category at the end of March 2022. Overall, SEBI has to recover ₹96,609 crore from entities including those that failed to pay the fine imposed on them, failed to pay fees due to markets watchdog and did not comply with its direction to refund investors' money.

61.title: Ranveer Singh invited to represent India at FIFA World Cup final: Report
61.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has reportedly been invited to represent India at the FIFA World Cup 2022 final in Qatar. A source told Bollywood Hungama, "Ranveer has become a cultural phenomenon globally. He represents the aspirational youth of India globally...is the perfect ambassador to be there at the FIFA World Cup final." The final will take place on December 18.

62.title: We don't want our partners to watch us die of cold live on TV: Ukraine
62.article_body: Senior Ukrainian adviser Mykhailo Podolyak has said western allies must speed up delivery of defensive weapons to protect energy infrastructure in the war-torn nation. "[They must] transfer as quickly as possible...defensive weapons so that Russia doesn't kill [Ukrainians] by freezing them to death," he said. "We don't want our partners to watch us dying from...cold live on TV," he added.

63.title: BYJU'S announces business expansion, to hire 600 in Kerala
63.article_body: BYJU'S has announced plans to expand business in Kerala and hire 600 people in the state following Founder Byju Raveendran's meeting with Chief Minister P Vijayan. The company said it will add three more offices in the state in this financial year, taking the total number to 14. The company also revoked its plan to shut down the Thiruvananthapuram office.

64.title: Voting in byelections to 7 assembly seats in 6 states on Thursday
64.article_body: Bypolls to seven seats in six states will be held on Thursday (November 3). The bypolls will be held in Munugode (Telangana), Andheri East (Maharashtra), Mokama (Bihar), Gopalganj (Bihar), Adampur (Haryana), Gola Gokrannath (Uttar Pradesh) and Dhamnagar (Odisha). The polls were necessitated due to the sitting legislator's death or resignation from elected party or due to a criminal conviction.

65.title: Elon Musk's net worth has fallen $9 billion since Twitter takeover
65.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's net worth has dropped about $9 billion since he took over Twitter on October 28, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk's net worth fell to $203 billion, down nearly 25% since the beginning of 2022. However, Musk is still the world's richest person, ahead of world's second richest person Bernard Arnault by around $65 billion.

66.title: Blue tick on Twitter is signifier of clout: CRED founder Kunal Shah
66.article_body: After Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced $8/month price for blue tick, CRED Founder Kunal Shah called the tick a "signifier of clout" and said the decision would end in chaos. "Those with clout will lose their clout if they appear to be paying for this vanity badge...Those with no clout will buy...and try to appear important," Shah tweeted.

67.title: Look at rupee depreciation sans emotions: Shaktikanta Das
67.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das appealed to people to look at the depreciation of the rupee without any emotions and in the context of the current geopolitical crisis. He added that in comparison with other major currencies, the rupee has depreciated less. "The rupee has seen a very orderly movement since the onset of the current geopolitical crisis," Das added.

68.title: Google Chrome adds new sidebar for faster search results
68.article_body: Google has launched a new sidebar in Chrome that can make it faster and easier to check out search results without moving back and forth between multiple tabs. Users can click "Open search in side panel", which will display results in a side panel. The feature is reportedly similar to Microsoft Edge's sidebar.

69.title: Stalin like my brother, couldn't leave without meeting him: Mamata
69.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that Tamil Nadu counterpart MK Stalin is like her brother and she couldn't have left Chennai without meeting him. "I came to attend a family function but could not have left without meeting with Stalin...we did not discuss anything about politics," Mamata told ANI. The two leaders met at Stalin's residence.

70.title: Explore how specially-abled people can be in civil services: SC to Centre
70.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the Centre to explore how specially-abled people can be put under different categories in the civil services. A bench of Justices SA Nazeer and V Ramasubramanian said, "You please examine. They may not fit into all categories. Sympathy is one aspect, practicality is another aspect." Attorney General R Venkataramani sought time to look into the matter.

71.title: Poland to build temporary barrier along its border with Russia
71.article_body: Poland's Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak said the construction of a temporary barrier along the country's border with Russia will begin on Wednesday. The barrier, which will be 2.5 m high and 3 m deep, will be built along the Russian exclave of Kaliningrad, said Blaszczak. The barrier's construction will be completed by the end of 2023.

72.title: Yograj Singh joins Haasan's 'Indian 2', says 'Lion of Punjab is ready'
72.article_body: Former India cricketer Yograj Singh took to Instagram and announced that he will feature in Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2'. He shared a picture of himself in the makeup room. Along with the picture, Yograj wrote, "Big respect to all heroes behind the camera...The Lion of Punjab is ready for 'Indian 2'...with Kamal Haasan ji (legend)."

73.title: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's chopper makes emergency landing
73.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma's helicopter made an emergency landing near Shillong due to inclement weather on Wednesday, officials said. Sangma was flying from Tura to Shillong, an official said. "Emergency landing at UCC (Union Christian College) in Umiam...but enjoyed the view of the lovely campus during my walk...what a day!" Sangma tweeted.

74.title: Dy CM Fadnavis' wife urges Maha govt to not provide her traffic clearance vehicle
74.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis on Wednesday requested Mumbai Police to not provide her a traffic clearance pilot vehicle. It was provided to her as part of her security upgrade cleared by the state's Home Department, headed by Devendra Fadnavis. "I am and wish to live like a common citizen of Mumbai," she said.

75.title: How can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals?
75.article_body: Pakistan are currently placed fifth on T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 2 points table. To advance, Pakistan would need to beat South Africa and Bangladesh, and would need India or South Africa to lose their final Super 12 match. In case South Africa and India win, Pakistan would be knocked out even if they win their remaining matches.

76.title: Which multiple T20 World Cup records does Virat Kohli hold?
76.article_body: Virat Kohli today broke the record for scoring most runs (1,065) in T20 World Cup history. Kohli also holds the record for the highest batting average (88.75) in T20 World Cup history. Further, he has hit most fifties (13) in T20 World Cups. Kohli also has the most Player of the Match awards (seven) in the tournament history.

77.title: Let 'KGF' be our mantra: Piyush Goyal as he invites people to invest in Karnataka
77.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the Invest Karnataka summit, invited people to invest in Karnataka by saying, "Let KGF be our mantra - Karnataka Growth & Future." Goyal said, "Wherever I go, there's great excitement about Karnataka." He added, "There's a large amount of investor interest leading to the investment potential of at least ₹7 lakh crore."

78.title: Was told 'Industry will not get you back if you take break': Sarika
78.article_body: Actress Sarika said that her friends panicked when she decided to take a break from her acting career for a year. "My friends...told me, 'Don't be stupid! This industry...will not get you back'," she added. "I was like...if I am offered an old woman's role, I would happily take that up as well. I just wanted to act," she stated.

79.title: Saddened by death of Ela Bhatt, she'll long be remembered: PM Modi
79.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the death of 89-year-old women's rights activist Ela Bhatt who passed away on Wednesday. The PM tweeted, "Saddened by the death of Elaben Bhatt. She will long be remembered for her efforts to promote women's empowerment, social service, and education among the youth...Om Shanti." Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said, "She devoted her life to Gandhian ideals."

80.title: Jairam Thakur is HP's accidental CM, even Biden can't save him: Oppn leader
80.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh, Leader of Opposition Mukesh Agnihotri called CM Jairam Thakur an "accidental CM". Agnihotri stated that Thakur's government has been a non-performing one, further claiming that the latter is dependent on PM Narendra Modi's support for survival. "No one can save [Thakur] now, not even [US President] Joe Biden," Agnihotri said.

81.title: We see no signs that Russia is preparing to use nuclear weapons: US
81.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby has said the US doesn't see any signs that Russia is making preparations to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. Kirby said, "We've been clear...that Russia's comments about the potential use of nuclear weapons are deeply concerning." "We...monitor this as best we can and...see no indications that Russia is making preparations for such use," he added.

82.title: Craze for glimpse of SRK's 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented: Director
82.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand has said that there was no better day to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' than Shah Rukh Khan's birthday. "The craze for a glimpse of 'Pathaan' has been unprecedented. After a long, long time there's [an] insane buzz for a film that's genuine and organic...it's all due to the super stardom of...Shah Rukh," he added.

83.title: Amazon's m-cap falls below $1-trillion mark for first time since April 2020
83.article_body: Shares of e-commerce firm Amazon fell on Tuesday, taking the firm's market capitalisation (m-cap) below the $1-trillion mark for the first time since April 2020. Amazon's stock fell 5.5% to close at $96.79 at an m-cap of $987.4 billion. This comes after Amazon reported its earnings last week, when it projected the slowest July-September quarter growth in its history.

84.title: UK sanctions 4 Russian steel, petrochemical tycoons funding Putin's war
84.article_body: UK has sanctioned four Russian steel and petrochemical business owners "who rely on Russian President Vladimir Putin for their positions of authority and fund his military machine", Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said. "[We're] ramping up the economic pressure on Putin and will...do so until Ukraine prevails," he said. Those sanctioned include Alexander Frolov, ex-CEO of steel producer Evraz.

85.title: Video shows EVM, chairs being thrown as men clash during Haryana panchayat polls
85.article_body: Clashes broke out between two groups during polling for the panchayat election in Zahidpur village of Haryana's Jhajjar district on Wednesday. A video has surfaced showing some people throwing chairs at each other. They were also seen throwing an electronic voting machine (EVM) and election materials. An EVM was damaged in the incident.

86.title: 153 commercial premises in Thane fined for lacking Marathi signboards
86.article_body: As many as 153 shops and commercial establishments in Maharashtra's Thane district have been fined for not displaying signboards in the Marathi language. Thane Deputy Labour Commissioner Santosh Bhosale said 15 of the 153 establishments were fined ₹3.49 lakh. As per the state government's directives, all commercial establishments and shops are expected to display signboards in Marathi.

87.title: Can tackle attrition by seeking new talent sources: Rishad Premji
87.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said the IT sector faces high level of attrition because companies chase the same talent pool. In order to widen the talent pool, he said that new locations and sources must be sought and flexibility of remote work should be provided. He added that to tackle attrition they should also reskill existing pool with new-age technologies.

88.title: 2 men stripped, paraded and whipped for selling beef in Chhattisgarh; video surfaces
88.article_body: Two men were stripped, paraded and whipped with a belt for allegedly selling beef in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district. The two men have been arrested and police said over 33 kg of beef was recovered from them. There is also no information on whether any action has been taken against the men involved in whipping them.

89.title: IIT alumni founded AlmaBetter raises $2.7 mn from Kalaari Capital, others
89.article_body: Upskilling startup AlmaBetter raised $2.7 million in a seed round led by Kalaari Capital. The round also saw participation from investors such as Vidit Aatrey (CEO, Meesho), Sanjeev Barnwal (CTO, Meesho) and Varun Alagh (CEO, MamaEarth), among others. AlmaBetter was founded by IIT Delhi and Kharagpur alumni Shivam Dutta, Vikash Srivastava, Ravi Kumar Gupta, Arshyan Ahsan and Alok Anand.

90.title: 16-yr-old electrocuted to death at coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara
90.article_body: A 16-year-old student, Debi Prasad Dash, was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a high-tension wire at a residential coaching centre in Odisha's Kendrapara, police said on Wednesday. Dash, a resident of Gopinath village, accidentally came in contact with an 11 KV line. The deceased's family members have filed an FIR against the coaching centre authorities alleging negligence.

91.title: Congress' promise to restore old pension scheme is a bait: Himachal CM
91.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur criticised Congress over its promise to restore the old pension scheme, calling it a bait and said the scheme was ended during Congress leader Virbhadra Singh's government. "Now their eyes are on the vote...they feel that something can be done by giving inducements," Thakur said, questioning why the scheme wasn't restarted between 2013 and 2017.

92.title: Hackers send fake mails to exploit Musk's plan to charge for blue tick
92.article_body: Hackers are sending phishing emails to lure Twitter users for a blue tick in an attempt to get their account credentials, according to a report. The phishing attacks began after Twitter's new owner Elon Musk announced an $8 monthly fee for a blue tick in subscribers' accounts. The emails have "don’t lose your free verified status" in the subject line.

93.title: Unverified screenshot on Covid curb easing causes $450 bn stock rally in China
93.article_body: An unverified screenshot of four paragraphs detailing China's reopening plan following the lawmakers' meeting with COVID-19 experts went viral in China, causing a $450-billion rally in stocks. The screenshot, with no identifying marks, began circulating on Monday night in WeChat groups filled with analysts and fund managers. Prominent economists and financial platforms also shared the screenshot.

94.title: Lotus Herbals acquires 20% stake in startup Yogic Secrets
94.article_body: Lotus Herbals said that it has acquired a 20% stake in direct-to-consumer nutraceuticals and health supplement startup Yogic Secrets Healthcare for an undisclosed amount. According to a joint statement, Yogic Secrets will use the funds to scale up its operations in India and also expand globally. This is Lotus' fifth investment in emerging brands in the beauty and wellness space.

95.title: Pregnancy may change woman’s bones forever: Study
95.article_body: A study has found that pregnancy can permanently change the makeup of a woman’s bones. Anthropologists have discovered that female primates who had babies show reduced levels of calcium and phosphorus as compared to those who have not reproduced. A significant drop in magnesium levels as a result of breastfeeding was also noticed in their bones.

96.title: Google to discontinue its dedicated Street View app in 2023: Report
96.article_body: Google has announced plans to discontinue its dedicated Street View app on Android next year. According to a report by 9to5Google, the company has prepared a notice to advice users to shift to Google Maps or Street View Studio. The app, launched in July in India, allows users to explore an area through 360-degree panoramic street-level images.

97.title: Another Maharashtra transport bus catches fire; all 43 passengers safe
97.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus carrying 43 passengers caught fire in Maharashtra's Nashik on Wednesday. The bus driver immediately stopped the bus on the side of the Sinnar-Nashik-Pune road and pulled out all the passengers. A similar incident took place in Pune on Tuesday.

98.title: MP official, yet to receive govt bungalow, living in tent for 3 months
98.article_body: The panchayat chief of a Madhya Pradesh district has been living in a tent for the past three months as he is yet to get a government bungalow. Rudesh Paraste from Dindori district told ANI that he's attending to the residents' problems while living in the tent. "We're facing many issues but will manage to serve the public," he said.

99.title: Independent India's first voter, aged 106, casts vote in Himachal
99.article_body: Shyam Saran Negi, the first voter of independent India, cast his vote for the 34th time by voting for Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections through a postal ballot on Wednesday. This is the first time the 106-year-old cast his vote at his residence. Kinnaur Deputy Commissioner Abid Hussain Sadiq greeted the retired school teacher with a Kinnauri cap and a muffler.

100.title: Media had painted me as bold, always got negative roles: Neena Gupta
100.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said she always got negative roles after the media had "painted" her as bold. "Fighting this tag was very frustrating for many years. It truly was. It was important back then to get typecast," she added. Neena said that she suffered as she never followed the "trend". "Not anymore, now I'm happy, satisfied and thankful," she stated.

101.title: Cobra dies after being bitten by 8-year-old boy in Chhattisgarh
101.article_body: A cobra reportedly died after it was bitten by an eight-year-old boy in Pandrapath village of Chhattisgarh. The snake got wrapped around the boy's hand and bit him. As the reptile didn't budge after he tried to shake it off, he bit it, following which it died. The boy was administered anti-snake venom doses and discharged from the hospital.

102.title: India to have above-normal minimum temperature in November: IMD
102.article_body: The minimum temperatures are expected to be above normal during November over most parts of the country, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand are also likely to experience above-normal day temperatures. IMD Director General Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said there could be cloudy conditions in the region.

103.title: Only those from political families considered for CM’s post in Congress: Shah
103.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah held several election rallies across Himachal Pradesh and accused Congress of luring politicians by promising to make them the Chief Minister. "This is only a ploy to win some seats," Shah said. "In the Congress, it's mandatory that one is from a political family for being considered for the post of Chief Minister," he added.

104.title: PM should be summoned in many cases: JMM leader on ED summons to Hemant Soren
104.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) summoned Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren in a money laundering probe linked to an alleged illegal mining case, JMM leader Manoj Pandey accused the Centre of vendetta politics. "PM should also be summoned in several cases," Pandey said. "We'll approach the court if there's injustice. Don't know if the ED can summon a CM," he added.

105.title: Formula E race track in Hyderabad to be ready by end of November
105.article_body: Ahead of the Formula E race in Hyderabad next year, Urban Development Special Chief Secretary Arvind Kumar inspected the ongoing works undertaken by the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA). "The track will be ready by the end of November," Kumar tweeted. The first-ever Formula E race in India is scheduled to be held in Hyderabad on February 11, 2023.

106.title: More people are going to get hurt if US political climate persists: Obama
106.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama on Wednesday said that "more people are going to get hurt" unless the US political climate changes. Obama's comments came after a man attacked the husband of the Speaker of the House, Nancy Pelosi, fracturing his skull and causing other injuries. "This increasing habit of demonizing political opponents creates a dangerous climate," Obama added.

107.title: Vinod Kapri shares video comparing air quality, visibility in Delhi and Mumbai
107.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted a video comparing the air quality and visibility in Delhi and Mumbai on Wednesday. "This was taken at 9:40 am in Delhi and 11:33 am in Mumbai," he tweeted. Tagging Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, he asked, "Is it the Congress government in Punjab or the Modi government at the Centre who's responsible for Delhi's horrific pictures?"

108.title: How does the points table read after India's 3rd win in T20 World Cup 2022?
108.article_body: After bagging their third victory in T20 World Cup 2022, India jumped to the top position on the Super 12 stage Group 2 points table. India have accumulated six points. South Africa follow India with five points, while Bangladesh are third with four points. Bangladesh are followed by Zimbabwe (three points), Pakistan (two points) and Netherlands (two points).

109.title: Arunachal will be favourite film shooting destination after 'Bhediya': CM
109.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu took to Twitter and thanked 'Bhediya' director Amar Kaushik and producer Dinesh Vijan after the film was entirely shot in the state. "I'm sure Arunachal is going to be a favourite film shooting destination...The film will give a new identity to the people of North East," he tweeted. 'Bhediya' features Varun Dhawan.

110.title: Indian economy an island of calm amid global challenges: Sitharaman
110.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the Indian economy is an island of relative calm in a challenging global environment. Sitharaman added that while India had its share of challenges, they weren't large enough to threaten the country. "Honourable Prime Minister...made sure the Indian economy will not be severely threatened by the developments outside," Sitharaman said.

111.title: SRK fans parade outside Mannat, sing 'Baadshah O Baadshah'; video surfaces
111.article_body: Several fans of Shah Rukh Khan marched outside his bungalow, Mannat, in Mumbai on Wednesday afternoon. A video that surfaced online showed fans holding placards and banners featuring the actor. While some fans can be seen chanting "We love Shah Rukh" in the video, another group is seen singing "Baadshah O Baadshah" to celebrate the actor's 57th birthday.

112.title: Adani Group to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Karnataka in 7 years: Karan Adani
112.article_body: Karan Gautam Adani said Adani Group has plans to invest almost ₹1 lakh crore over the next seven years in Karnataka in an attempt to expand its footprint in multiple sectors. He said, "We are seeking to capitalise on unmatched strength the state offers in the tech space." "Adani Group will expand the Mangaluru airport as well," Adani shared.

113.title: Indian envoy to US asks TAC Security CEO to aid Indian startups
113.article_body: Indian Ambassador to the US, Taranjit Singh Sandhu, met CEO of cybersecurity firm TAC Security, Trishneet Arora and asked him to help out startups in India, including Punjab. According to a tweet posted by Sandhu, the two discussed cyber threats, technology and knowledge partnership and the importance of mentorship and skill development. Trishneet, the 28-year-old founder, was born in Ludhiana.

114.title: Violence erupts as rival groups hurl stones amid Haryana panchayat polls
114.article_body: Violence broke out between two rival groups in Haryana's Nuh district on Wednesday morning during panchayat elections in Chandaka village. The groups also hurled stones at each other. Varun Singla, Nuh's Superintendent of Police, said, "A home guard was injured after a stone hit his chest." As per reports, several police personnel were injured during the altercation.

115.title: Hindi version of 'Kantara' beats lifetime collection of 'KGF 1'
115.article_body: The Hindi version of 'Kantara' has surpassed the lifetime collection of Yash's Hindi-dubbed 'KGF: Chapter 1', as per trade analyst Taran Adarsh. "Week three will be higher than week one and week two. [The film] will cross ₹50 crore mark in week three. THIS FILM IS TRULY UNSTOPPABLE," Taran tweeted. The film is directed and written by Rishab Shetty.

116.title: Microsoft Prez Smith warns of talent shortage to combat climate change
116.article_body: Microsoft President Brad Smith said thousands of companies will fail to meet pledges to combat climate change unless they start training employees on sustainability. "Companies should...pay for continuing education and convene on carbon-reduction strategies," Smith said. Microsoft has grown its sustainability headcount to about 250 employees from only 30 in last three years, he added.

117.title: We urge all to keep calm: Russia as N Korea fired over 20 missiles
117.article_body: After North Korea fired over 20 missiles into the water on Wednesday, Russia called for calm. "We urge everyone to keep calm...All parties to this conflict should avoid taking any steps that could provoke a further increase in tensions," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Reportedly, one of the missiles fired by North Korea landed close to South Korea's territorial waters.

118.title: 10.5 km walk to be precise: Pooja Bhatt on tweet calling walk with Rahul Gandhi 'brief'
118.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has reacted to a tweet by a media house that read, "Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt briefly joins the Congress party's Bharat Jodo Yatra. The Yatra resumed from Hyderabad city in Telangana this morning." "Yes a 'brief' 10.5 km walk to be precise," she responded. The Bharat Jodo Yatra commenced on September 7 from Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

119.title: L-G launches 'Operation Clean Delhi' ahead of India's G-20 presidency
119.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has launched sanitation drive 'Operation Clean Delhi' from the city's Mayapuri area. The focus of the initiative will be to ensure cleanliness and beautification so that guests to G-20 meetings carry back a "good impression" of Delhi. India is set to assume the presidency of the G-20 for one year from December 1, 2022.

120.title: Why no CBI, ED action over Morbi bridge collapse?: Mamata Banerjee
120.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee questioned why there was no action by central agencies, such as the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED), in the Morbi Bridge collapse incident. Alleging that the agencies only act against common people, she further questioned, "Why are they not investigating people who are playing with the lives of others?"

121.title: When I became assistant director, I chased films SRK was part of: Ayan
121.article_body: On the occasion of actor Shah Rukh Khan's birthday, 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji revealed he chased films that Shah Rukh was part of, after he became an assistant director. "I'm a huge Shah Rukh Khan fan and have been touched by his, like magnetism in a very deep way," he added. Shah Rukh had a cameo in Ayan's 'Brahmastra'.

122.title: It's our responsibility to protect party that protected you: BJP's Nadda
122.article_body: Speaking at a public rally in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP National President JP Nadda said, "PM Narendra Modi ji made two vaccines on our land within nine months, inoculated all of you with double dose and booster dose and shielded you." "Now is the time to protect. It is our responsibility to protect the party who protected you," he added.

123.title: Planning to set up new prison, 7 more police stations in Mumbai: Fadnavis
123.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the state government is planning to set up a new prison and seven new police stations in Mumbai. Currently, there is only one Arthur Road Jail in Mumbai. "Discussion on requirement of new jail in Mumbai, Nagpur, Pune also took place," Fadnavis tweeted after a meeting with the police officials on Tuesday.

124.title: Video shows Bengaluru's new e-buses getting charged
124.article_body: A video of new state-run electric buses getting charged in Bengaluru is being widely shared online. A transport corporation official is seen charging the buses at Yelahanka Bus Station. The electric buses are charged daily at Majestic, Puttenahalli and Yelahanka bus stations. The buses are charged for about 1 hour which powers them to run for 200 km.

125.title: AirAsia sells remaining 16.33% stake in AirAsia India to Air India
125.article_body: AirAsia Aviation Group (AAAGL), holding company of Capital A's airline group, announced that it has sold its remaining stake in its India operations to Air India. The company said AAAGL is expected to receive ₹155.6 crore in gross proceeds. The company added that Capital A has marked the remaining 16.33% in AirAsia (India) (AAI) to its fair value.

126.title: Shah Rukh Khan shares his selfie with a sea of fans on his 57th birthday
126.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to share his selfie that showed a sea of his fans in the background that had gathered outside his house in Mumbai to wish him on his 57th birthday. "It's so lovely to live in front of the sea...the sea of love that spreads all around me on my birthday," the actor tweeted.

127.title: K'taka govt inks ₹5.20 lakh crore deals in B'luru investors meet
127.article_body: The Karnataka government inked investment agreements worth ₹5.20 lakh crore on Wednesday, on the first day of the three-day Invest Karnataka 2022 - Global Investors Meet, which is being held in Bengaluru. The 'Manufacturing-Green Hydrogen and Derivatives' sector received the most investments as seven companies signed Memorandums of Understanding worth ₹2.9 lakh crore in the sector.

128.title: Driver abducts 2-year-old girl, rapes her inside truck’s cabin in Gujarat
128.article_body: A 25-year-old truck driver was arrested for allegedly abducting a 2-year-old girl from a road in Gujarat's Surat and raping her inside the truck's cabin during the early hours of Tuesday. Police caught the accused red-handed around six kilometres away from the spot from where she was kidnapped. The girl has been hospitalised with severe injuries to her private parts.

129.title: India defeat Bangladesh in rain-curtailed match, go top of T20 WC 2022 points table
129.article_body: India defeated Bangladesh by five runs (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 2 match on Wednesday. With the victory, India went top of Group 2 points table with six points. Bangladesh were given a revised target of 151 runs from 16 overs after rain interruption. India restricted them to 145/6 in 16 overs.

130.title: PM Modi inaugurates over 3,000 flats built for slum dwellers in Delhi
130.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has inaugurated 3,024 newly constructed flats to house slum dwellers in Delhi. The flats, which have been built at a cost of ₹345 crore, are located in south Delhi's Kalkaji area. "Today is a big day for thousands of slum dwellers; a new beginning to life," PM Modi said at the function to mark the occasion today.

131.title: 2 killed, 2 injured as car falls into roadside gorge in Raj's Baran
131.article_body: Two people died and two others were injured when their car fell into a deep gorge in Rajasthan's Baran, police said on Wednesday. The incident took place when the four persons were returning home after attending a wedding in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, Bapcha SHO Surendra Kuntal said. The police patrolling vehicle rushed them to a community health centre at Bapcha.

132.title: Foreign investors, MFs increase stake in Paytm for second straight quarter
132.article_body: Paytm, in its latest shareholding pattern filing, said foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and mutual funds increased stakes in its parent One97 Communications for the second consecutive quarter in the July-September period. Stake of foreign investors increased from 5.14% to 5.77% in the quarter. Mutual funds also increased their stake to 1.26% in the September quarter from 1.14% a quarter ago.

133.title: Padma Bhushan recipient and women's rights activist Ela Bhatt passes away aged 89
133.article_body: Noted women's rights activist, lawyer and Padma Bhushan recipient Ela Bhatt passed away on Wednesday at the age of 89. She founded and headed the Self-Employed Women's Association (SEWA) in India. She also set up a cooperative bank in 1974 to provide small loans to women and co-founded Women's World Banking (WWB), a global network of micro-finance organisations.

134.title: Woman, child flung into air as car rams into bike in Pune, video surfaces
134.article_body: A woman and her child were flung into the air when a car rammed into the motorcycle they were riding on in Pune. The accident took place when the two vehicles were taking a turn. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online, showing the duo getting thrown in the air as the car rams the motorcycle's rear part.

135.title: TN ministers, officials hold high-level meeting amid heavy rainfall
135.article_body: Several Tamil Nadu ministers, Chennai Mayor R Priya, Greater Chennai Corporation Commissioner Gagandeep Singh Bedi and other officials held a high-level meeting in Chennai to take stock of the situation amid heavy rainfall. Minister KN Nehru said 205.47 mm of rainfall was recorded in Chennai between October 31 and November 2. Waterlogging was reported in only three subways, he added.

136.title: IFS officer shares pic of snake, says 'Let's see who can guess the species'
136.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a picture of a snake. "This beauty. Let's see who can guess the species," he wrote. "King Cobra; Ophiophagus hannah. 'Ophiophagus' is derived from Greek, meaning 'snake-eating' and hannah is derived from the name of tree-dwelling nymphs in Greek mythology," he later added. "The snake whose 100% diet is other big snakes," his tweet read.

137.title: Govt planning PLI 2.0 for textiles to compete with Vietnam, China: Goyal
137.article_body: Textile Minister Piyush Goyal said the government is considering the second phase of the Production Linked Incentive scheme for the textile industry to help the industry compete with top markets like Vietnam and China. He said industry officials have been asked to undertake extensive stakeholder consultations. Goyal emphasised that the textile sector's USP should not be restricted to cheap labour.

138.title: Pune woman reports husband missing, arrested months later for his murder
138.article_body: A woman from Pune's Baramati, who approached the police in February stating that her husband had gone missing, was arrested months later for his murder. Police have also arrested the woman's lover and his two friends. The woman, along with her lover and his friends, had allegedly beaten the man to death and dumped his body in a water stream.

139.title: Maruti Suzuki crosses 2.5 crore production mark in India
139.article_body: Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it has crossed 2.5 crore cumulative production mark since starting operations in India in 1983. "2022 marks 40 years of Suzuki's partnership with the people of India," said CEO Hisashi Takeuchi. The company has become the only Indian original equipment manufacturer (OEM) to have achieved this feat in passenger vehicle production.

140.title: Inspect repair work done by BBMP: K'taka HC to NHAI amid pothole deaths
140.article_body: The Karnataka HC has ordered the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to inspect repair work done on potholes in Bengaluru. The court also criticised the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for the number of fatalities caused by potholes. A 22-year-old biker died after being hit by a car that overturned due to a pothole in the city last month.

141.title: Carcasses of 3 cows found in Mumbai forest, case filed
141.article_body: Carcasses of three cows were found in a forest in Mumbai, police said on Wednesday. Police took the carcasses in their possession to send them for post-mortem. A case has been filed against unidentified people under Section 429 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). The incident was reported near Aarey Milk Colony Unit 17 in Goregaon area.

142.title: Govt raises cost of ethanol for blending in petrol by ₹2.15
142.article_body: The Union Cabinet raised the cost of ethanol procured by public sector oil marketing companies (OMCs) for blending into petrol by ₹2.15. The cost has been raised to ₹65.6 per litre from ₹63.45 per litre. Price of ethanol from C heavy molasses was increased to ₹49.41 per litre while ethanol derived from B heavy molasses will cost ₹60.73 per litre.

143.title: Still not convinced with his approach: Ganesh on KL Rahul's 50(32)
143.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh took to Twitter to share his opinion on KL Rahul's 50(32) in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, stating that he's still "not convinced" by Rahul's approach in the powerplay. "You can't play the waiting game in the powerplay," added Ganesh in his tweet. Rahul had a strike rate of 156.25.

144.title: That's his opinion: Akram on Gambhir criticising Babar's captaincy
144.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Gautam Gambhir criticising Babar Azam's captaincy, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "That is his opinion...Everybody, I suppose, has a right to give their opinion." Talking about Babar's captaincy during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands, Gautam Gambhir had said, "[He] should have sent Fakhar Zaman up the...order. This is called selfishness."

145.title: Accountability should be fixed: Mamata on Morbi bridge collapse
145.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident in Gujarat, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the accountability should be fixed. "I'll not talk anything about politics...People's lives are important than politics. I express my condolences," she added. "A judicial commission should be made under the Supreme Court to probe the Morbi incident," Banerjee stated.

146.title: Ukrainian man plotting to sabotage Crimea power line detained: Russia
146.article_body: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that a Ukrainian citizen has been detained over suspicion of planning to "sabotage" a power line in Crimea. The man, in his 40s, had been found carrying diagrams of power lines, three explosive devices and instructions on how to use them. The FSB suspected that the man had been recruited by Ukrainian intelligence.

147.title: K’taka believes in converting calamity into opportunity: CM Bommai
147.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said that his government believes in converting calamity into an opportunity. "We've to believe in ourselves...believe in our capabilities and abilities during the tough times," Bommai added while speaking at the Global Investors Meet 2022. "Karnataka is not only a place with a better ecosystem but we are a forward-looking policy state," he stated.

148.title: Man keeps ₹250 cr lottery win in China a secret from family fearing they'll get lazy
148.article_body: A man in China is keeping his 219 million yuan (around ₹250 crore) lottery jackpot a secret from his family. "I didn't tell my wife and child, for fear that they would be too complacent and wouldn't work or work hard in the future," he said. He collected the prize money alone in a costume that kept his identity hidden.

149.title: Virat Kohli's reaction to KL Rahul's 96-metre six against Bangladesh goes viral
149.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli's reaction to KL Rahul's 96-metre six on the bowling of Bangladesh's Shoriful Islam in India's ninth over in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Wednesday. In the video, Kohli can be seen following the trajectory of the ball while appearing shocked. Rahul scored 50(32) in the innings.

150.title: The ones calling it boring are jealous: Shekhar on 'Bigg Boss 16' segment
150.article_body: Actor Shekhar Suman said that those calling his 'Bigg Boss 16' segment "boring" are either "jealous people" or "bought bots". "It could be the work of rival channels, competitors or even people who don't like the fact that I am back," he added. Shekhar Suman is seen hosting the 'Bigg Bulletin' segment on the reality show's Sunday episode.

151.title: Driver of Kerala minister’s staff arrested for assaulting woman
151.article_body: A contract driver of Kerala Water Resources Minister Roshy Augustine's private secretary was arrested for allegedly assaulting a woman when she was out for a morning walk near Thiruvananthapuram's Museum area, police said. The driver has also been arrested for trespassing into a house recently, an officer of Museum police station said.

152.title: MU to give new marksheets to more than 3,000 law students over PRN error
152.article_body: The Mumbai University (MU) will give new marksheets to over 3,000 final-year law students after it was found that Permanent Registration Number (PRN) on them was erroneous, an official said. The content in the marksheets is correct, except for the 16-digit PRN, a unique reference number throughout the course, the official added. The error was detected in 3,064 marksheets.

153.title: Delhi govt appeals to people to work from home amid worsening air quality
153.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday appealed to people to work from home amid worsening air quality in the national capital. Rai further appealed to people to adopt the practice of carpooling and avoid taking out private vehicles, saying, "50% of the pollution is from vehicles." Notably, Delhi's overall air quality on Wednesday morning was recorded as 'very poor'.

154.title: Kyiv shoots down 12 of 13 'kamikaze' drones in latest attack: Ukraine
154.article_body: Kyiv was targeted in more drone attacks overnight, head of the Ukrainian President's office said. Andriy Yermak said 12 out of 13 drones launched towards Kyiv were shot down, adding that Iranian-made "kamikaze" drones were used again. Ukraine maintains that the drones have been used to attack the country's infrastructure. Russia earlier denied using "kamikaze" drones in Ukraine.

155.title: BYJU'S cancels 140 layoffs in Kerala after Founder Raveendran meets CM
155.article_body: Edtech startup BYJU'S has decided to continue its office operations in Kerala's Trivandrum, revoking the layoff of 140 employees who operate from that centre. The development came after a detailed discussion between Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and the startup's Founder Byju Raveendran. A week back, BYJU'S was planning to shut down the Kerala office.

156.title: SRK watched 'Don' & partied with us in Australia: Vidya Malavade
156.article_body: Actress Vidya Malavade recalled that during the Australia schedule of 'Chak De! India', Shah Rukh Khan took the whole team out to watch his film 'Don'. "I actually watched the film sitting next to him," she shared, adding that he also took all of them out to party. She remembered that they called him 'papa' when he was not around.

157.title: Puneeth Rajkumar got excited about 'Kantara', he later refused: Rishab
157.article_body: Rishab Shetty, who played the lead and directed 'Kantara', revealed he offered the film to late actor Puneeth Rajkumar. "Soon after I narrated the story to him, he got very excited about the project. He wanted to explore different stories," he added. "One day, he called me and asked me to go ahead with the film without him," Rishab stated.

158.title: Brilliant, Indian batting looks more formidable: Irfan on Rahul's 50(32)
158.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to term KL Rahul's 50 off 32 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh as "brilliant", adding that the Indian batting looks "more formidable". "We should stop...overhyping on [the basis of] one innings...and take...notice of how it's been over a period of time," read a reaction to his tweet.

159.title: Pollution issue isn’t state’s problem, it happens due to air system: Gopal Rai
159.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday requested the UP and Haryana governments to form a regional special task force to reduce air pollution in areas adjoining Delhi like Gurugram, Faridabad, Ghaziabad and Noida. "The pollution problem is not the state's problem. It happens due to the air system that develops," Rai said.

160.title: Couple pays contract killers ₹8 lakh to get alcoholic son killed in T'gana
160.article_body: A couple in Telangana's Khammam district reportedly hired contract killers for ₹8 lakh to get their only son killed. They were allegedly fed up with him as he was an alcoholic and used to beat them. The 26-year-old man was strangled to death and his body was found dumped in Suryapet. Police have arrested the couple.

161.title: IT professional robbed, assaulted by fake policemen on Pune road
161.article_body: Three people posing as policemen robbed an IT engineer on Pimpalgaon road in Pune district after stopping his car and accusing him of violating traffic rules on Monday. The accused made the victim sit in their car on the pretext of taking him to police station. They robbed his phone and assaulted him with an iron rod when he resisted.

162.title: Sun Pharma's m-cap crosses ₹2.5 lakh crore after 7 years
162.article_body: The market capitalisation of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries crossed ₹2.5 lakh crore for the first time in more than seven years as its shares gained the most among its Nifty 50 peers on Wednesday. Its stock surged by 1.81% to ₹1,051.75/piece on BSE. On Tuesday, Sun Pharmaceutical reported a 10.5% year-over-year rise in its consolidated net profit in the July-September quarter.

163.title: Vanished from industry when I was still a top contender: Anu Aggarwal
163.article_body: Anu Aggarwal of 'Aashiqui' fame expressed that she was facing "the dark night of the soul" when she was at the peak of success in her acting career. "Ironically, when the world thought I had everything, I was the unhappiest ever," she said. Anu added that she "vanished" from the film industry when she was "a top contender".

164.title: T'gana Guv launches first aid master training programme in Hyderabad
164.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Tuesday inaugurated the first aid master trainers' training programme in Hyderabad's Raj Bhavan. Around 20 health practitioners from states including Telangana, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh will be trained to be ready to respond during emergencies. "Appealed all to be aware of first aid, that plays vital role in saving lives," she tweeted.

165.title: Delhi to get special mohalla clinics for women, will provide free services
165.article_body: Delhi will now have special mohalla clinics for women where gynaecological services, tests and medicines will be made available to beneficiaries free of charge. "Another new initiative is going to happen in the national capital's world-class health services from today," Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote on Twitter. The mohalla clinic system is a flagship healthcare scheme of the Kejriwal government.

166.title: Pune civic body staffer finds 11 live cartridges, weapons in bag
166.article_body: A 42-year-old Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) cleaning staffer found 11 live cartridges, three choppers, three knives and other weapons in Warje-Malwadi. "The (staffer) found the weapons in a bag in the nullah. It looks like self-loading rifle and pistol cartridges but it is yet to be confirmed," police said. A case has been registered under the Indian Arms Act.

167.title: Infosys to seek shareholders' nod for ₹9,300 crore share buyback
167.article_body: Infosys said that it will seek approval from shareholders for its proposed ₹9,300 crore share buyback between November 3 to December 2 through postal ballot. The buyback is proposed to be implemented by way of open market purchases through Indian stock exchanges. The buyback will be undertaken for a price not exceeding ₹1,850 per equity share.

168.title: Delhi couple killed by 2 fired employees in 'act of revenge'; 2-yr-old kid lone survivor
168.article_body: A couple and their domestic help were murdered at their house in Delhi by two former employees in an "act of revenge", said the police. The wife ran a beauty parlour and had recently fired the two employees, police added. As per officials, the killers missed the couple's two-year-old daughter as she was sleeping under a blanket.

169.title: BMC postpones hike in rent of civic-owned properties till June 2023
169.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has postponed the hike in rent of over 3,500  civic-owned properties till June 2023. These properties house over 45,000 tenants. "We have...decided to postpone the hike...since many tenants are yet to recover from the financial losses they faced during the...lockdown," an official said. Currently, the tenants are charged between ₹100 and ₹250 per month.

170.title: Faridabad restaurant serving hookah at a party raided, 26 arrested
170.article_body: The Chief Minister's flying squad and Faridabad Police raided the basement of a restaurant in Sector 86, where a party was in progress, and arrested 26 people, including eight women, for allegedly serving and consuming hookah. The people were found smoking flavoured tobacco, which is banned, and liquor was being served at the party without a licence, the police said.

171.title: He is gold for us: Phillips on Kane Williamson's 40(40) vs England
171.article_body: Discussing Kane Williamson's 40 off 40 balls in New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 match against England, New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips said, "Williamson is gold...for us. He understands situations." "England bowled really well to him and...shut down his areas," added Phillips. "He could...easily get 50 off 20 balls...[in the next game], so we back him fully," he stated.

172.title: Woman missing since 5 yrs reunited with family in J'khand through Aadhaar
172.article_body: A 23-year-old woman who went missing five years ago was reunited with her family in Jharkhand with the help of the Aadhaar database. The woman, Rashmani, was rescued by railway police and housed at a shelter home in UP in 2017 after she deboarded a Delhi-bound train. Rashmani's address was traced when officials tried to apply for her Aadhaar card.

173.title: Akasa Air to start Bengaluru–Pune direct flights on November 23
173.article_body: Akasa Air has added Pune to its service and will launch double daily flights on the Bengaluru-Pune route from November 23. India's newest airline will also start its sixth and seventh frequency flight on the Bengaluru-Mumbai route. With these additions, Akasa Air will offer 20 daily flights from Bengaluru connecting seven cities—Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Delhi, Chennai, Kochi, Guwahati and Pune.
