The crowd crush killed 101 women and 55 men. As many as 104 people who died were in their 20s and 12 were teenagers. Over 100,000 people were reportedly present at the time of the stampede.

348.title: Belgium, Australia are favourites to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Dutch defender
348.article_body: Former Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden said that Australia and Belgium are the favourites to win the upcoming FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023. "They (Australia-Belgium) look very strong...I hope Netherlands can lift the WC...Hockey over the past 20 years has become more and more about fitness. The young players are becoming fitter at a young age," Weerden said.

349.title: Suresh Raina joins Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators
349.article_body: Former India player Suresh Raina has joined the Abu Dhabi T10 League franchise Deccan Gladiators. Raina will play alongside Andre Russell, Nicholas Pooran, Jason Roy, Odean Smith and Taskin Ahmed for the Gladiators. Raina announced his retirement from IPL and BCCI cricket in September and it was reported he'll play in T20 leagues in South Africa, Sri Lanka and UAE.

350.title: Confident that BJP will form govt in Himachal: Jitendra Singh
350.article_body: Union minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said he is 100% confident that BJP will win the upcoming Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh and form the government again. "The kind of environment that we are seeing here, it seems that...common people have decided that BJP government should be formed once again," Singh said. "Jairam ji will be the CM," he added.

351.title: All who are trying to lose weight will identify with 'Double XL': Farah
351.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan reviewed Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi's film 'Double XL' after attending a special screening. Farah stated that Sonakshi and Huma were "wonderful" in the film and added that Zaheer Iqbal and Mahat Raghavendra were "very cute". "All of us who are constantly dieting or trying to lose weight or everybody...will identify with it," she added.

352.title: England's Walker & Kalvin Phillips likely to recover before World Cup: Pep Guardiola
352.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said English footballers Kyle Walker and Kalvin Phillips are likely to recover from their injuries before the FIFA World Cup. "Kyle, I'm impressed how quick his recovery (is) but still a bit late compared to Kalvin," said Guardiola. Walker underwent groin surgery in early October, while Phillips has been sidelined due to a shoulder problem.

353.title: Russia fines Wikipedia owner $32,600 for not deleting Ukraine war entries
353.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Wikimedia Foundation, the owner of Wikipedia, 2 million roubles ($32,600) over articles relating to the Ukraine war. Stanislav Kozlovsky, head of the foundation's Russia chapter, said the penalty was imposed for not deleting entries that Russia has demanded be removed. Earlier this year, Russian authorities fined Wikimedia 5 million roubles over similar violations.

354.title: Days of 'raja-rani' are over, it's the time of common people: Shah in Himachal
354.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday criticised the Congress and said that in a democracy like India, the days of "raja-rani" are over, it is now the time of common people. Addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh ahead of Assembly polls, Amit Shah said, "Change this tradition of alternative governments and repeat the BJP in the state."

355.title: Govt proposes common ITR form for everyone, invites stakeholder comments
355.article_body: The Finance Ministry has proposed to introduce a common income tax return form for all taxpayers, under which income from virtual digital assets will have to be disclosed under a separate head. The Central Board of Direct Taxes has invited stakeholder comments on the form by December 15. All taxpayers, except trusts and non-profit organisations, can use the proposed form.

356.title: Star Sports urges fans to believe in blue as India look to end the wait
356.article_body: The Indian Cricket Team looks to return to winning ways against Bangladesh in the upcoming match as it aims to secure a berth in the semi-finals of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022. Sports-lovers can tune in to watch the action LIVE on Star Sports & Disney+ Hotstar on Wednesday, November 2, 1 PM onwards.

357.title: Atmosphere was incredible: Ex-Dutch player recalls 2018 WC QF against India
357.article_body: Ex-Netherlands defender Mink van der Weerden recalled the 2018 FIH Men's Hockey World Cup quarter-final match against India which was played at Bhubaneswar's Kalinga Stadium. "The whole atmosphere was incredible...They were the most special circumstances I have ever played a game in...It was a full crowd that day and the home fans were loudly cheering for India," Weerden said.

358.title: Ex-Chief Secy Narain tampered with evidence: Andaman admin to SC
358.article_body: The Andaman and Nicobar Islands administration has told the Supreme Court (SC) that it has proof its former Chief Secretary Jitendra Narain, who is accused of gangrape and sexual abuse, "tampered with the evidence". Narain had directed the private operator of CCTV cameras to remove them, it said. Further, the Union Territory's administration challenged the anticipatory bail given to Narain.

359.title: Italy PM vows to tighten laws after illegal rave busted in Modena
359.article_body: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni vowed to tighten laws against unauthorised parties after police busted a rave in the city of Modena on Monday, which, according to residents, had been going on for two straight days. Police reportedly arrested 14 organisers of the illegal rave and confiscated audio equipment worth €150,000 (₹1,22,31,767). The party was purportedly organised in an abandoned warehouse.

360.title: Puneeth Rajkumar posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna
360.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar was posthumously awarded Karnataka Ratna at an event held in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The event was attended by Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai and actors Rajinikanth and Jr NTR. The award was received by Puneeth's wife. Several people attended the award ceremony amid heavy rainfall.

361.title: Odisha court sentences man to 20 yrs in jail for raping a minor, who's now his wife
361.article_body: A 25-year-old man, who married the girl he was accused of raping when she was a minor, was sentenced to 20 years in jail by a fast-track court in Odisha's Angul district. Last year, he married her after she turned 18. The judge, however, sentenced him, saying that such offences leave an indelible mark on the mind of the child.

362.title: Got into music after getting fired from job in New York: Prateek Kuhad
362.article_body: Singer Prateek Kuhad revealed he got into music after getting fired from a consulting firm in New York. "I got fired from my job...I was wondering what I could do now...I decided to take a year off and try this (music) out. I never liked doing that (job) anyway," he added. Prateek said he was "very frustrated" with the job.

363.title: T20 World Cup is a ruthless tournament: England captain Buttler
363.article_body: After England won their second match of T20 World Cup 2022 against New Zealand, England captain Jos Buttler said, "It's a ruthless tournament, last year South Africa went out despite having four wins out of five games." He added that his side had the confidence that showed up today and they didn't think too much about the past "poor performance".

364.title: PM Modi to inaugurate over 3,000 flats in Delhi tomorrow
364.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate 3,024 flats for economically weaker sections (EWS) at Kalkaji in South Delhi on Wednesday. He will hand over the keys to some of the beneficiaries of the in-situ slum rehabilitation project, a statement from Prime Minister's Office said. The flats have been built at a cost of ₹345 crore.

365.title: 8-ft-long crocodile enters house at night in UP in search of food, pic surfaces
365.article_body: A family in UP's Etawah woke up to find an eight-foot-long crocodile in their house. The home's owner said it entered the house at night in search of food when they were sleeping. They called police who told them to lock the reptile inside the house. They stayed awake throughout the night and the rescue operation started in the morning.

366.title: Rohith Vemula symbol of struggle against injustice: Rahul Gandhi
366.article_body: After he was joined by Radhika Vemula, Rohith Vemula's mother, in the morning leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Rahul Gandhi said that Vemula is and will remain the symbol of his struggle against social discrimination and injustice. Rohith, a Dalit student, died by suicide in 2016 following alleged harassment. "By meeting Rohith's mother...the journey gained new courage", Rahul said.

367.title: India to overtake Germany as 4th largest economy by FY26: RBI Dy Guv
367.article_body: During an event, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Michael Patra said that India will overtake Germany to become the world's fourth-largest economy by 2025-26. By 2027, India will overtake Japan and become the third-largest economy, he said. "India's population will become the largest in the world next year...It'll demand the world's best financial intermediation services," he added.

368.title: I've got lot of experience, happy to help in any way I can: Smith
368.article_body: After not being played so far in the T20 World Cup, Australian batter Steve Smith said that he has a lot of experience and is happy to help in any way possible. "If you have got someone who is able to bat through...and let the hitters go around them, that has worked pretty well...I can play that role," Smith said.

369.title: Uber's Q3 revenue rises 72%, adjusted earnings hit record $516 million
369.article_body: Uber Technologies on Tuesday said its revenue for the July-September quarter was $8.34 billion, up 72% from last year. Meanwhile, the company's adjusted earnings hit record $516 million in Q3 and gross bookings also grew 26% to $29.12 billion. "Even as the macroeconomic environment remains uncertain, Uber's core business is stronger than ever," said Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi.

370.title: SC rejects plea to put candidates' age, education on ballots & EVMs
370.article_body: The Supreme Court declined to hear a plea directing the Election Commission to replace party symbols on ballots and electronic voting machines (EVMs) with age, educational qualifications and photographs of candidates. The petition, filed by advocate Ashwini Upadhyay, said this will help voters elect honest candidates and "control the dictatorship of political party bosses in ticket distribution".

371.title: I agreed to do 'Bhediya' after hearing just the one-line idea: Varun Dhawan
371.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan revealed he agreed to feature in 'Bhediya' after hearing the one-line idea. He added that he was in constant touch with producers as he didn't want to let go of 'Bhediya'. "My biggest dream as an actor is to entertain through a diverse array of roles. 'Bhediya' is the most important addition to that endeavour," he added.

372.title: Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources: Zaheer on India's loss vs SA
372.article_body: Zaheer Khan said that Rohit Sharma-led India got their T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa to that level from where they had to just finish it and they lost. He added, "10 overs and 94 to get. You created panic in...South African side...It felt like...to a certain degree that Rohit was maybe not able to use his resources."

373.title: SpaceX launches Falcon Heavy rocket after 3-year hiatus
373.article_body: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy was launched from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida, for the first time in over three years. The mission, called USSF 44, included a rocket system having three Falcon 9 boosters strapped side-by-side with two US Space Force satellites. The Space Force asked SpaceX to end the launch live stream early and not show their deployment.

374.title: Conman's ₹10 cr claim attempt to divert attention from Morbi: Kejriwal
374.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said allegations that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar paid ₹10 crore to AAP’s Satyendra Jain as “protection money” is an attempt to divert attention from the Morbi incident. "Before Punjab polls, they came out with Kumar Vishwas. Now, the BJP...has produced Sukesh,'' said Kejriwal. Chandrashekhar has reportedly claimed the same in a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena.

375.title: Projects must respect sovereignty: Jaishankar at SCO meet hosted by China
375.article_body: Connectivity projects should respect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO), External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said at a virtual meeting of SCO Council of Heads of Government. "Fair market access is to our mutual benefit and only way to move forward," he added. The meeting was hosted by Chinese Premier Li Keqiang.

376.title: Shocked to know of Gujarat bridge collapse, extend deep condolences: Chinese Prez
376.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said he was "shocked" to learn about the deadly bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi that killed 135 people and injured over 100 others. "On behalf of the Chinese government and...people, I would like to express our deep condolences to the victims and extend our sincere sympathy to their families and the injured," he said.

377.title: Hurt by media trial: Raj Kundra on why he hides his face behind masks
377.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Raj Kundra wrote that he wears face masks for the media. "[I] don't wish to give the media a chance to click my face! I'm hurt by the media trial they put me through," he further tweeted. Raj was arrested in July 2021 in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps.

378.title: Develop techniques to conserve water resources: Prez to scientists
378.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to develop water resource conservation techniques. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role," she said. Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat also said there is a need for a holistic approach to conservation.

379.title: Police shoots man after he drives through barricaded area in Omaha
379.article_body: A man was shot and wounded by a police officer on Monday night after the former recklessly drove his car through a barricaded area during a Halloween party in US' Omaha, police said. The driver's name has not yet been released. Police say no one else was injured in the incident that took place in Omaha's Minne Lusa neighbourhood.

380.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi dresses as Shaktimaan for Halloween, shares video
380.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi took to Instagram and shared a video of himself dressed as Pandit Gangadhar Shastri transforming into Shaktimaan for Halloween. In the video, Sidharth also revealed that he tore off the pants of his Shaktimaan costume. Along with the video, Siddhant wrote, "Sorry Shaktimaan." The actor recently featured in 'Gehraiyaan'.

381.title: Modi govt moving towards 'licence raj': Cong's Prithviraj Chavan
381.article_body: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan criticised the Narendra Modi-led Centre over the issue of several major investments going to the state of Gujarat. "The way...Modi government is behaving it seems they are moving towards licence raj...which the Congress had brought to an end in the past," Chavan said. "It's not good for the country," he added.

382.title: Discussions on global spillovers one of the G20 priorities: FM Sitharaman
382.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that discussions on global spillovers will be one of the priorities on the agenda of India's upcoming G20 presidency. Sitharaman added, "How much can India and low- and middle-income countries bear the brunt of spillovers and how can you be ready for unpredictable spillovers?" India will be handed over G20 presidency in December from Indonesia.

383.title: AAP releases eighth list of 22 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
383.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its eighth list of 22 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has nominated youth leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja from Dahegam and Koli leader Raju Solanki, who joined the AAP last week, from Bhavnagar West. The AAP is the only party that has declared over 100 candidates for the elections so far.

384.title: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah resigns after Musk's takeover
384.article_body: Twitter's Chief Customer Officer Sarah Personette, who joined the company in 2018, resigned shortly after Elon Musk's Twitter takeover. "I wanted to share that I resigned on Friday from Twitter and my work access was officially cut off last night," Sarah tweeted. Earlier last week, Business Insider reported that she would get $11.2 million in payout.

385.title: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raises ₹100 cr in debt funding
385.article_body: Foodtech unicorn Rebel Foods raised ₹100 crore in a debt funding round from InnoVen Capital and Trifecta Capital. The board of Rebel Foods also passed a resolution to issue 10,000 Series E non-convertible debentures at an issue price of ₹1,00,000 per share to raise ₹100 crore. So far, the Sequoia-backed startup has raised $536.5 million in funding.

386.title: Prez Murmu to visit Nagaland on Nov 2,3; to inaugurate schools, roads
386.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will embark on a two-day visit to Nagaland on November 2 and 3, officials said. On her maiden visit to Nagaland after assuming office, President Murmu will virtually inaugurate newly constructed government schools, Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) roads and Kohima Super Market. She is also scheduled to meet state ministers at Raj Bhavan in Kohima.

387.title: BJP, TRS workers clash on last day of Munugode bypoll campaign
387.article_body: A clash broke out between workers of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and BJP on the last day of the Munugode bypoll campaign on Tuesday. TRS MLC P Rajeshwar Reddy and MLA Peddi Sudarshan Reddy were among those injured in the incident. BJP state president Bandi Sanjay Kumar alleged that TRS is "unable to bear the massive response" received by BJP.

388.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
388.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy rainfall warning for states/UTs including Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 to 5. It stated thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from November 2 and 5. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Andhra Pradesh on November 2 and 3, it added.

389.title: Don't use my photos in Bharat Jodo Yatra publicity material: Digvijaya to Congress
389.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh requested Congress' Madhya Pradesh unit to not use his photographs in the publicity material for Bharat Jodo Yatra. He said photos of former Congress Presidents Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, present party chief Mallikarjun Kharge and Kamal Nath should be used. State Congress spokesperson Narendra Saluja said Singh has been against publishing his photos for long.

390.title: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants detained for blocking Kolkata road
390.article_body: Nearly 100 teaching job aspirants demanding appointment in schools were detained in Kolkata's Salt Lake area on Tuesday for blocking a road without informing authorities, a police officer said. The protestors claimed to have been deprived of teaching jobs despite having qualified in the recruitment tests conducted by the West Bengal School Service Commission.

391.title: 17-yr-old murdered by two men for not sharing WiFi hotspot password in Maha
391.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was murdered by two men for not giving them the WiFi hotspot password in the Kamothe area in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai. "The two accused stabbed the victim after a fight broke out between them," said Vivek Pansare, DCP Zone-1, Navi Mumbai. Police said the two men were under the influence of alcohol when they committed the crime.

392.title: Was ousted from a film just before taking flight to shoot location: Anchal
392.article_body: Actress Anchal Singh, known for shows 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein' and 'Undekhi', revealed that she was once ousted from a film just before taking a flight to shoot location. Adding that she "felt awful", Anchal said, "It took time...to overcome that loss." Anchal further said now she's in a place where she feels secure when it comes to getting work.

393.title: Show me instance where BJP fought in favour of OBC reservation: Siddaramaiah
393.article_body: Speaking to reporters in Bengaluru, Congress leader Siddaramaiah asked them to show one instance where BJP has fought in favour of reservation for backward classes since Independence. The former Karnataka CM accused the BJP of being "anti-reservation". He also said that the centre's decision regarding the 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Section was not in line with the Constitution.

394.title: Actor Anshuman Jha ties the knot with athlete Sierra Winters, shares pics
394.article_body: Actor Anshuman Jha, who has appeared in films like 'LSD: Love, Sex Aur Dhokha' and 'Pari', tied the knot with athlete Sierra Winters on October 29. The wedding took place in North Carolina, USA. Anshuman also shared pictures from his wedding on his Instagram handle. In an interview, he said, "I always wanted to find a partner who inspires me."

395.title: Tech Mahindra's attrition rate drops to 20%, hires 5,877 people in Q2
395.article_body: Tech Mahindra reported a decline in its attrition rate to 20% during the July-September quarter from 22% reported in the first quarter ended June 30, 2022. The company added 5,877 new hires in Q2, taking its total headcount to 1,63,912. "[We] believe that we need to manage headcount with...view to build future," Tech Mahindra CEO and MD CP Gurnani said.

396.title: 40 pistols & 36 magazines seized from car in MP, accused absconding
396.article_body: A cache of illegal weapons, including 40 pistols and 36 magazines, was seized from a car after a long chase by the police in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone district, Police Commissioner Harinarayanachari Mishra said on Tuesday. In a bid to avoid police, the driver increased the speed of the car and while escaping, hit a police vehicle, Mishra added.

397.title: Actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join BJP: JP Nadda
397.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda has stated that actress Kangana Ranaut is welcome to join the party. He added, "But as far as contesting the polls is concerned, it is not my decision alone...Everyone is welcome to join the BJP. But in what capacity, the party decides." Ranaut recently said she is willing to fight elections from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi.

398.title: Make double engine govt again & we'll make Himachal drug-free: Shah
398.article_body: Addressing a public rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said, "Make double engine government (BJP) again and we will make Himachal Pradesh drug-free." Notably, voting for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections will take place on November 12. The counting of votes will take place on December 8.

399.title: Credit to the way England played: NZ skipper Williamson after loss
399.article_body: After losing to England by 20 runs on Tuesday, New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said that credit goes to their opponent for the way they played. "England put us under pressure. They played beautifully...they were clinical. It was a slightly above-par total. We tried to take it a little deep, but credit to the way they bowled," Williamson said.

400.title: Not the CEO you're looking for: Banker Parag as profile visits rise 36% after Twitter CEO's firing
400.article_body: After Parag Agrawal was fired as Twitter CEO, a banker with the same name as his, shared a screenshot showing a 36% surge in his LinkedIn profile visits. Sharing the data, he wrote, "To help folks with finding the right Parag, I've changed my profile page headline." Agrawal then updated his bio to, "Not the CEO you are looking for."
